questions.prompt: Every player who has won the NHL's Hart Memorial Trophy (MVP) and is eligible for the Hockey Hall of Fame has been elected, except for three: Tommy Anderson, Al Rollins, and who else? This third player won it as a Philadelphia Flyer after the lockout-shortened 1994-95 season (a season that, in a bitter coincidence, was the last season for the Quebec Nordiques).

Six of the seven European colonial powers that controlled 90% of the African continent at the end of the "Scramble for Africa" in 1914 were France, Germany, Italy, Portugal, Spain, and the United Kingdom. What was the seventh?
Theirs not to make reply,/Theirs not to reason why,/Theirs but to do and die: these famous lines reflect the bravery and the futility that underlie what famous poem?
questions.answer: the charge of the light brigade

questions.prompt: Legendary movie cinematographer Haskell Wexler won an Oscar in 1976 in part for his creative use of what novel filmmaking apparatus, recently introduced by inventor Garrett Brown, who initially dubbed his device the "Brown Stabilizer"?
Although most rivers on the Indian subcontinent have female names, one major exception is named for the son of the creator god in the Hindu Trimurti. What is that river's name?

One common metric used in the capital budgeting process within corporations and other businesses, measuring the profitability (and thus desirability) of a particular investment, is abbreviated IRR. What do the letters in IRR stand for?
